abstract.p: Time Warner Inc chairman Gerald M Levin letter on May 15 article denies merged AOL-Time Warner plans 'super-editor' post to supersede Time Inc's editor in chief

block.p: Re '' 'Super-Editor' Spot May Be Created at Post-Merger AOL-Time Warner'' (Business Day, May 15):

Steve Case, the chairman of America Online, and I never considered a ''super-editor'' position to supersede Time Inc.'s editor in chief. Like Time Inc., CNN has its own tradition of journalistic integrity that it actively safeguards.
Re '' 'Super-Editor' Spot May Be Created at Post-Merger AOL-Time Warner'' (Business Day, May 15):

Steve Case, the chairman of America Online, and I never considered a ''super-editor'' position to supersede Time Inc.'s editor in chief. Like Time Inc., CNN has its own tradition of journalistic integrity that it actively safeguards.

Whether in print or programming, the editorial quality and independence of Time Warner's news operations have never been in question, and I have neither perceived nor discussed the need for a new level of supervision.
GERALD M. LEVIN Chairman and Chief Executive Time Warner Inc. New York, May 17, 2000
